questions.question: পাণ্ডুলিপি' কোন সমাস?
questions.explanation: যে সমাসে বিশেষণ বা বিশেষণভাবাপন্ন পদের সঙ্গে বিশেষ্য বা বিশেষ্যভাবাপন্ন পদের সমাস হয় ও পরপদের অর্থের প্রাধান্য থাকে, তাকে কর্মধারয় সমাস বলে। যেমন: পাণ্ডু (চলনসই) যে লিপি = পাণ্ডুলিপি, যিনি জজ তিনি সাহেব = জজসাহেব।

questions.question: 'Deputation' শব্দটির বাংলা পরিভাষা কোনটি?
questions.explanation: কতিপয় পারিভাষিক শব্দ: বিদেশি শব্দ পরিভাষা বিদেশি শব্দ পরিভাষা Delegate প্রতিনিধিবর্গ Domicile স্থায়ী নিবাস Diposit আমানত Dummy প্রতিরূপ

questions.question: 'ইতর বিশেষ' বাগ্ধারাটির অর্থ কী?
questions.explanation: কতিপয় বাগধারাঃ লঙ্কাভাগ (স্বার্থচিন্তা), চক্রতোলা (ফণা তোলা), চুনোপুঁটি (সামান্য লোক), সাত-সতের (বিচিত্র রকমের), ইঁদুর কপালে (মন্দ ভাগ্য)।

questions.question: সে পুনরায় কহিল, "ঘন জঙ্গলের পথ, একটু দেখে পা ফেলে যেয়ো" কোন গল্পের অংশ?
questions.explanation: অপরাজেয় কথাশিল্পী শরৎচন্দ্র চট্টোপাধ্যায়ের 'বিলাসী' গল্পে বর্ণিত হয়েছে দুই ব্যতিক্রমধর্মী মানব-মানবীর অসাধারণ প্রেমের মহিমা, যা ছাপিয়ে উঠেছে জাতিগত বিভেদের সংকীর্ণ সীমাকে।

questions.question: অরুণ' শব্দের অর্থ কী?
questions.explanation: কতিপয় শব্দের অর্থ: অনিন্দ্য- নন্দিত নির্বন্ধ- বিধান পরুষ- কর্কশ আসার- জলকণা

questions.question: Complete the analogous pair: SONG: CYCLE:: SONNET:
questions.explanation: Song এ যেমন cycle থাকে তেমন sonnet এ sequence থাকে।

questions.question: Just as disloyalty is the mark of the renegade ______ is the mark of the ____.
questions.explanation: Disloyalty (বিশ্বাসঘাতকতা) যেমন renegade (দলত্যাগকারী / বিশ্বাসঘাতক) এর স্বভাব, cowardice (কাপুরুষতা) তেমনি craven (কাপুরুষ) এর স্বভাব।

questions.question: Although the economy suffers downturns, it also has strong _______ and self correcting tendencies.
questions.explanation: Recuperative পুনরুদ্ধারের যোগ্য এমন। Although দ্বারা দুটি বিপরীত clause যুক্ত হয়। যদিও অর্থনীতি মন্দার (downturn) সম্মুখীন হয় তথাপি এর economy পুনরুদ্ধারের এবং আত্ম সংশোধনের প্রবনতা রয়েছে।

questions.question: As _____ head of the organization, he attended social functions and meetings but had no _____ in the formulation of company policy
questions.explanation: তিনি প্রতিষ্ঠানের নামমাত্র (titular) প্রবীণ হিসেবে সামাজিক অনুসন্ধানে যোগদান করলেও কোম্পানির নীতি বাস্তবায়নে বা গঠনে তাঁর কোনো নিয়ন্ত্রণ নেই।

questions.question: One phase of the business cycle is expansion phase. This phase is a twofold one, including recovery and prosperity. During the recovery period there is ever-growing expansion of existing facilities, and new facilities for production are created. More businesses are created, and older ones expanded. Improvements of various kinds are made. There is an ever- increasing optimism about the future of economic growth. Much capital is invested in machinery. More labor is employed. More raw materials are required. As one part of the economy develops, other parts are affected. For example, a great expansion in automobiles results in an expansion of the steel, glass, and rubber industries. Roads are required, Thus, the cement and machinery industries are stimulated. Demand for labor and materials results in greater prosperity for workers and suppliers of raw materials, including farmers. This increases purchasing power and the volume of goods bought and sold. Thus, prosperity is diffused among the various segments of the population. This prosperity may continue to rise and rise without an apparent end. However, a time comes when this phase reaches a peak and stops spiraling upwards this is the end of the expansion phase. Which of the following statements is the best examples of the optimism mentioned in the passage as being part of the expansion phase?

options.label: ক
options.text: As technology advances innovative businesses replace antiquated firms.

options.label: খ
options.text: Full employment is achieved at all levels of the economy

options.label: গ
options.text: The prices of agricultural commodities are increased at the producer level.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Industrial firms allocate funds for the purchase of machine tools.

questions.option_a: As technology advances innovative businesses replace antiquated firms.
questions.option_b: Full employment is achieved at all levels of the economy
questions.option_c: The prices of agricultural commodities are increased at the producer level.
questions.option_d: Industrial firms allocate funds for the purchase of machine tools.
questions.explanation: প্রযুক্তির অগ্রগতির সাথে সাথে ব্যবসায়ীক ধরণে যে পরিবর্তন এসেছে সেটিই ইতিবাচক দিক।

questions.question: One phase of the business cycle is expansion phase. This phase is a twofold one, including recovery and prosperity. During the recovery period there is ever-growing expansion of existing facilities, and new facilities for production are created. More businesses are created, and older ones expanded. Improvements of various kinds are made. There is an ever- increasing optimism about the future of economic growth. Much capital is invested in machinery. More labor is employed. More raw materials are required. As one part of the economy develops, other parts are affected. For example, a great expansion in automobiles results in an expansion of the steel, glass, and rubber industries. Roads are required, Thus, the cement and machinery industries are stimulated. Demand for labor and materials results in greater prosperity for workers and suppliers of raw materials, including farmers. This increases purchasing power and the volume of goods bought and sold. Thus, prosperity is diffused among the various segments of the population. This prosperity may continue to rise and rise without an apparent end. However, a time comes when this phase reaches a peak and stops spiraling upwards this is the end of the expansion phase. Which of the following statements would be most likely to begin the paragraph immediately following the passage?

options.label: ক
options.text: The other phase of business cycle is called the recession phase.

options.label: খ
options.text: The farmer's role during the expansion phase is of vital importance

options.label: গ
options.text: Union demands may also have effect on business cycles.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Inflation is a factor that must be taken into discussion of business cycles.

questions.option_a: The other phase of business cycle is called the recession phase.
questions.option_b: The farmer's role during the expansion phase is of vital importance
questions.option_c: Union demands may also have effect on business cycles.
questions.option_d: Inflation is a factor that must be taken into discussion of business cycles.
questions.explanation: Business cycle এর অন্য একটি দিককে বলা যেতে পারে মন্দা প্রভাব। এই লাইনটি দিয়েও Passage টি শুরু করা যেত।

questions.question: One phase of the business cycle is expansion phase. This phase is a twofold one, including recovery and prosperity. During the recovery period there is ever-growing expansion of existing facilities, and new facilities for production are created. More businesses are created, and older ones expanded. Improvements of various kinds are made. There is an ever- increasing optimism about the future of economic growth. Much capital is invested in machinery. More labor is employed. More raw materials are required. As one part of the economy develops, other parts are affected. For example, a great expansion in automobiles results in an expansion of the steel, glass, and rubber industries. Roads are required, Thus, the cement and machinery industries are stimulated. Demand for labor and materials results in greater prosperity for workers and suppliers of raw materials, including farmers. This increases purchasing power and the volume of goods bought and sold. Thus, prosperity is diffused among the various segments of the population. This prosperity may continue to rise and rise without an apparent end. However, a time comes when this phase reaches a peak and stops spiraling upwards this is the end of the expansion phase. It can be inferred from the passage that the author believes that _______.

options.label: ক
options.text: When consumers lose their confidence in the market, a recession follows.

options.label: খ
options.text: Cyclical ends to business expansion are normal

options.label: গ
options.text: Luxury goods such as jewelry are unaffected by industrial expansion.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: With sound economic policies, prosperity can become a fixed pattern.

questions.option_a: When consumers lose their confidence in the market, a recession follows.
questions.option_b: Cyclical ends to business expansion are normal
questions.option_c: Luxury goods such as jewelry are unaffected by industrial expansion.
questions.option_d: With sound economic policies, prosperity can become a fixed pattern.
questions.explanation: ব্যবসায়ের পরিবর্ধনে পরিবর্তন একটি স্বাভাবিক বিষয়।

questions.question: Select the correct spelling.
questions.explanation: Vulnerability - দুর্বলতা।

questions.question: Identify the error: (i) Divergence in response to (ii) evolution is commonly (iii) by altering the form (iv) of parts of the organism.
questions.explanation: Option B তে commonly এর স্থলে common হবে। Be verb / linking verb এর পর adjective হয়।

questions.question: The astringent quality of the unsweetened lemon juice made swallowing difficult. The underlined word is a/ an:
The antonym of ENERVATE is:
questions.explanation: Enervate (শক্তিহীন করা/দুর্বল করা) এর বিপরীত শব্দ strengthen । Sputter থুথু ফেলা, arrange ব্যবস্থা করা।

questions.question: The antonym of IRREPARABLE is:
questions.explanation: Irreparable (অপূরণীয়/অসংশোধনীয়) এর বিপরীত শব্দ correctable (সংশোধনীয়)। Legible স্পষ্ট, সহজপাঠ্য, concise- সংক্ষিপ্ত।

questions.question: The synonym of MONETARY is:
questions.explanation: Monetary (অর্থবিষয়ক) এর সমার্থক শব্দ fiscal (রাজস্ব সম্পর্কিত বা রাজকোষ)।

questions.question: The synonym of NASCENT is:
questions.explanation: Nascent (বর্ধিষ্ণু/প্রথম পর্যায়ে বৃদ্ধি) এর সমার্থক শব্দ incipient (প্রাথমিক বা জায়মান)

questions.question: She couldn't qualify for the race- having trained very hard.
questions.explanation: In spite of সত্ত্বেও। তার ভালো প্রশিক্ষণ থাকা সত্ত্বেও সে দৌড় প্রতিযোগিতায় নির্বাচিত হতে পারেনি।

questions.question: She is ——- IBA, Jahangirnagar University.
questions.explanation: শিক্ষা প্রতিষ্ঠানের বিভাগ (IBA) এর পূর্বে in হয়।

questions.question: The best candidate should be appointed ——— the post.
questions.explanation: Appoint to নিয়োগ দেওয়া।

questions.question: Select the correctly spelt word.
questions.explanation: Bibliography - গ্রন্থবিবরণী।

questions.question: I went to the market and purchased sweets and ate them. The underlined word is a/an:
questions.explanation: দুটি clause কে যুক্ত করলে সেটা conjuction হয়।

questions.question: Find out the misspelt word.
questions.explanation: Acquaintance জানাশোনা।

questions.question: Age and experience ________ wisdom to a person
questions.explanation: And দ্বারা যুক্ত দুটি noun যদি same idea বা ধারণা বোঝায় তাহলে verb সর্বদা singular হয়। যেমন: time and tide, bread and butter, slow and steady etc এর পর সাধারণত singular verb বসে।

questions.question: Identify the error: The buzzing noises (i) Emitting from the alarm clock (ii) makes me cringe (iii) every time that I hear (iv) them.
questions.explanation: Noises plural subject তাই option B তে makes এর হলে make হবে।

questions.question: It is helpful for salesmen to develop a good _____ with their customers in order to gain their trust.
questions.explanation: Platitude- সাধারণ মন্তব্য, rapport- সম্পর্ক, disinclination অনীহা, tribute শ্রদ্ধা। বিক্রেতাকে কাস্টমারদের সাথে ভালো সম্পর্ক (rapport) গড়ে তুলতে হয়।

questions.question: Select the passive form: "I will never forget this experience".

options.label: ক
options.text: This experience is not forgotten by me.

options.label: খ
options.text: This experience would never be forgotten by me.

options.label: গ
options.text: This experience will never be forgotten by me.

questions.option_a: This experience is not forgotten by me.
questions.option_b: This experience would never be forgotten by me.
questions.option_c: This experience will never be forgotten by me.
questions.explanation: Future indefinite tense এর passive active form sub + will be + V3 + by + sub এর objective form।

questions.question: Select the direct form of speech, "The MLA addressed the people as ladies and gentlemen and said that their vote was his real power."

options.label: ক
options.text: The MLA said to people "Ladies and gentlemen, your vote is my real power.

options.label: খ
options.text: The MLA said, "Ladies and gentlemen, vote is my real power.

options.label: গ
options.text: "Ladies and gentlemen, your vote is my real power" said by the MLA.

questions.option_a: The MLA said to people "Ladies and gentlemen, your vote is my real power.
questions.option_b: The MLA said, "Ladies and gentlemen, vote is my real power.
questions.option_c: "Ladies and gentlemen, your vote is my real power" said by the MLA.

questions.question: To hit the nail right on the head" the correct meaning of the proverb./ idiom is:
questions.explanation: To hit the nail right on the head - সঠিক কাজ করা।

questions.question: Complete the analogous pair: Diva: Opera:: Thespian :
questions.explanation: Opera তে গান পরিবেশনকারীকে diva বলে। আর play তে অভিনয়কারীকে thespian (অভিনেতা) বলে।

questions.question: Corruption is _______ in our society; the integrity of even senior officials is_______.
questions.explanation: Rife বহুল প্রচলিত, সুবিস্তৃত, suspect সন্দেহজনক (adj)। দুর্নীতি আমাদের সমাজে বহুলপ্রচলিত, এমনকি বড় বড় অফিসারদের সততাও সন্দেহজনক।

questions.question: Find out the correctly spelt word.
questions.explanation: Influenza ভাইরাসঘটিত এক ধরনের ছোঁয়াচে সর্দিজ্বর।

questions.question: The antonym of REPEL is:
questions.explanation: Repel (প্রতিহত করা বা দূর করা) এর বিপরীত শব্দ attract (আকর্ষণ করা)।

questions.question: Which organization is the current sponsor of Bangladesh National Cricket Team?
questions.explanation: Bangladesh National Cricket Team Sponsor (2025): Daraz Bangladesh As of December 2025 , the official sponsor of the Bangladesh National Cricket Team is Daraz Bangladesh .

questions.question: Which is not a brand of PRAN-RFL ?
questions.explanation: Tasty Treat is a food subsidiary of PRAN-RFL Group. But it is a brand of future consumer Limited.

questions.question: Where is the new location of central tannery treatment plant in Bangladesh?
questions.explanation: Industry Minister Nurul Majid on 14 January 2019 said the work on the central Effluent Treatment plant at savar Tannery Estate will complete soon for smooth management of solid water.

questions.question: With which country Bangladesh signed first LNG import deal?
questions.explanation: The Maidan consignment of Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) reached Mohesh Khali from Qatar to supply imported gas to the national network.

questions.question: What is the GDP growth rate of Bangladesh for the fiscal year 2017-2018 calculated by Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics?
questions.explanation: In 2022-23 fiscal year estimated GDP growth rate is 7.5%.

questions.question: In which of the following Bangladeshi brand, And Financial Services Group (an affiliate company of the Chinese Alibaba Group) recently invested?
questions.explanation: Alipay, a concern of China's e-commerce and tech giant Alibaba Group has brought 20% stakes in bkash, Bangladesh's largest mobile financial service provider.

questions.question: In which of the following city, Pathao Ride Sharing Services is going to open its first overseas operation?
questions.explanation: This is the first time that a Bangladeshi ride sharing platform has launched operations beyond its borders. Pathao has built a platform that enables employment for thousands of drivers and a product that millions of customers use in Bangladesh.

questions.question: Which of the following is the widely accepted correct full form of 'Al'?
questions.explanation: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines especially computer systems.

questions.question: Which of the following rocket is used to launch Bangabandhu Satellite-1?
questions.explanation: Bangabandhu satellite - 1 is the first Bangladeshi geostationary communications and broadcasting satellite. It was manufactured by Thales Alenia Space and launched on 11 may 2018.

questions.question: Which of the following company recently shut its drug manufacturing operations in Bangladesh?
questions.explanation: Glaxosmithkline shut its drug manufacturing operations in Bangladesh by the end of 2018 and will continue with its healthcare business.

questions.question: The last digit of 133 45 ( 133 133^{45}(133 13 3 45 ( 133 to the power 45 ) ) ) is?
questions.explanation: The last digits of powers of 3 repeat in cycle of 9 , 7 , 1 , 3 9,7,1,3 9 , 7 , 1 , 3 . For this given problem, after repeat this cycle for 9 times will complete the power 45, which shows that last digit of 133 45 133^{45} 13 3 45 is 3 .

questions.question: Circle P is inside Circle Q, and the two circles share the same center X. If the circumference of Q is four times the circumference of P, and the redius of Circle P is three, what is the difference between Circle Q's diameter and Circle P's diameter?
questions.explanation: According to the question the circumference of Q = 4 × ( 2 π r ) = 4 ⋅ 2 ⋅ π ⋅ 3 = 2 ⋅ π ⋅ 12. = 24 π \mathrm{Q}=4 \times(2 \pi \mathrm{r})=4 \cdot 2 \cdot \pi \cdot 3=2 \cdot \pi \cdot 12 .=24 \pi Q = 4 × ( 2 π r ) = 4 ⋅ 2 ⋅ π ⋅ 3 = 2 ⋅ π ⋅ 12. = 24 π ∴ \therefore ∴ The diameter of Q = 24 Q=24 Q = 24 meter. ∴ \therefore ∴ The difference of two diameter is = 24 − 6 = 18 =24-6=18 = 24 − 6 = 18 meter.

questions.question: In a race of 10 km A beats B by 1 km and B beats C by 1 km. So by how many meters A beats C?
questions.explanation: S A : S B = 10 : 9 = 100 : 90   S B : S C = 10 : 9 = 90 : 81   S A : S B : S C = 100 : 90 : 81 = 10 : 9 : 8.1 \begin{array}{r} \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{A}}: \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{B}}=10: 9=100: 90 \\ \mathrm{~S}_{\mathrm{B}}: \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{C}}=10: 9=90: 81 \\ \mathrm{~S}_{\mathrm{A}}: \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{B}}: \mathrm{S}_{\mathrm{C}}=100: 90: 81=10: 9: 8.1 \end{array} S A ​ : S B ​ = 10 : 9 = 100 : 90   S B ​ : S C ​ = 10 : 9 = 90 : 81   S A ​ : S B ​ : S C ​ = 100 : 90 : 81 = 10 : 9 : 8.1 ​ A beats C By ( 10 − 8.1 ) k m (10-8.1) \mathrm{km} ( 10 − 8.1 ) km or 1.9 km or 1900 m

questions.question: There are four toys and they are of the same price. They worth $4.80. If the price for one is decreased by the fourth of the sum of other three toys, and two items of original price are added, then how much will six of them worth?
questions.explanation: The worth of 4 toys is. $ 4.80 \$ 4.80 $4.80 ∴ \therefore ∴ The worth of 1 toy is = 4.80 4 = $ 1.2 =\frac{4.80}{4}=\$ 1.2 = 4 4.80 ​ = $1.2 ∴ \therefore ∴ The worth of 3 toys is = $ ( 1.2 × 3 ) = $ 3.6 =\$(1.2 \times 3)=\$ 3.6 = $ ( 1.2 × 3 ) = $3.6 ∴ \therefore ∴ The decrease amount is = $ 3.6 4 = $ .9 =\$ \frac{3.6}{4}=\$ .9 = $ 4 3.6 ​ = $.9 ∴  Six of them worth is  = $ ( 4.8 + 1.2 + 1.2 − .9 ) = $ 6.30 \begin{aligned} \therefore \text { Six of them worth is } & =\$(4.8+1.2+1.2-.9) \\ & =\$ 6.30 \end{aligned} ∴  Six of them worth is  ​ = $ ( 4.8 + 1.2 + 1.2 − .9 ) = $6.30 ​

questions.question: A rectangular tiled floor is composed of 70 square tiles. The rectangular floor is rearranged so that 2 tiles are removed from each column and 4 tiles are added to each row. After the change in layout, the floor will still have 70 tiles, and still be rectangular. How many columns are in the tile floor before the change in layout?
questions.explanation: Let, the column number = x =x = x and the number of tiles in row. = y =y = y After Rearrange, we get, the number of row = y − 2 =y-2 = y − 2 & \& & the number of column = x + 4 =x+4 = x + 4 According to the question, ( x + 4 ) ( y − 2 ) = 70 & x y = 70 ⇒ x y + 4 y − 2 x − 8 = 70 ⇒ 4 y − 2 x − 8 = 0 [ ∵ x y = 70 ] ⇒ 2 x − 4 y = − 8 ⇒ 2 x − 4 ⋅ 70 x = − 8 ⇒ 2 x 2 − 280 + 8 x = 0 ⇒ x 2 + 4 x − 140 = 0 ⇒ x 2 + 14 x − 10 x − 140 = 0 ⇒ x ( x + 14 ) − 10 ( x + 14 ) = 0 ⇒ ( x + 14 ) ( x − 10 ) = 0 ∴ x = 10 ∴ x ≠ − 14 \begin{array}{l} (x+4)(y-2)=70 \& x y=70 \\ \Rightarrow x y+4 y-2 x-8=70 \\ \Rightarrow 4 y-2 x-8=0[\because x y=70] \\ \Rightarrow 2 x-4 y=-8 \\ \Rightarrow 2 x-4 \cdot \frac{70}{x}=-8 \Rightarrow 2 x^{2}-280+8 x=0 \\ \Rightarrow x^{2}+4 x-140=0 \\ \Rightarrow x^{2}+14 x-10 x-140=0 \\ \Rightarrow x(x+14)-10(x+14)=0 \\ \Rightarrow(x+14)(x-10)=0 \\ \therefore x=10 \therefore x \neq-14 \end{array} ( x + 4 ) ( y − 2 ) = 70& x y = 70 ⇒ x y + 4 y − 2 x − 8 = 70 ⇒ 4 y − 2 x − 8 = 0 [ ∵ x y = 70 ] ⇒ 2 x − 4 y = − 8 ⇒ 2 x − 4 ⋅ x 70 ​ = − 8 ⇒ 2 x 2 − 280 + 8 x = 0 ⇒ x 2 + 4 x − 140 = 0 ⇒ x 2 + 14 x − 10 x − 140 = 0 ⇒ x ( x + 14 ) − 10 ( x + 14 ) = 0 ⇒ ( x + 14 ) ( x − 10 ) = 0 ∴ x = 10 ∴ x  = − 14 ​ ∴ \therefore ∴ Before rearrange the column number was 10 .

questions.question: In the diagram, lines EF and DE are each tangent to the circle. If ∠FOD = 110°, What is the measure of ∠DEF?
questions.explanation: Solve We know, quadrilaterals makes 360 ∘ 360^{\circ} 36 0 ∘ . According to the given diagram, DEFO is a quadrilaterals. ∴ ∠ D E F + ∠ E F O + ∠ E D O + ∠ F O D = 360 ∘ ⇒ ∠ D E F + 90 ∘ + 90 ∘ + 110 ∘ = 360 ∘ ∴ ∠ D E F = 70 ∘ \begin{array}{l} \therefore \angle \mathrm{DEF}+\angle \mathrm{EFO}+\angle \mathrm{EDO}+\angle \mathrm{FOD}=360^{\circ} \\ \Rightarrow \angle \mathrm{DEF}+90^{\circ}+90^{\circ}+110^{\circ}=360^{\circ} \\ \therefore \angle \mathrm{DEF}=70^{\circ} \end{array} ∴ ∠ DEF + ∠ EFO + ∠ EDO + ∠ FOD = 36 0 ∘ ⇒ ∠ DEF + 9 0 ∘ + 9 0 ∘ + 11 0 ∘ = 36 0 ∘ ∴ ∠ DEF = 7 0 ∘ ​

questions.question: If n is a positive integer, then n (n+1) (n-1) is?

options.label: ক
options.text: Even only when n is even

options.label: খ
options.text: Odd only when n is even

options.label: গ
options.text: Odd only when n is odd

questions.option_a: Even only when n is even
questions.option_b: Odd only when n is even
questions.option_c: Odd only when n is odd
questions.explanation: If n = 2 , 3 , 4 n=2,3,4 n = 2 , 3 , 4 . ……… then, n ( n + 1 ) ( n − 1 ) = 2.3 \mathrm{n}(\mathrm{n}+1)(\mathrm{n}-1)=2.3 n ( n + 1 ) ( n − 1 ) = 2.3 . 1 which is divisible by 3 : 3. ( 3 + 1 ) ⋅ ( 3 − 1 ) = 3.4.2 (3+1) \cdot(3-1)=3.4 .2 ( 3 + 1 ) ⋅ ( 3 − 1 ) = 3.4.2 which is divisible by 3 . 4. ( 4 + 1 ) ( 4 − 1 ) = 4.5.3 (4+1)(4-1)=4.5 .3 ( 4 + 1 ) ( 4 − 1 ) = 4.5.3 which is divisible by 3 . ∴ n ( n + 1 ) ( n − 1 ) \therefore \mathrm{n}(\mathrm{n}+1)(\mathrm{n}-1) ∴ n ( n + 1 ) ( n − 1 ) always divisible by 3 .

questions.question: What are all the values of x x x so that x 2 − 3 x − 4 x^{2}-3 x-4 x 2 − 3 x − 4 is negative?
questions.explanation: x 2 − 3 x − 4 < 0 ⇒ x 2 − 4 x + x − 4 < 0 ⇒ x ( x − 4 ) + 1 ( x − 4 ) < 0 ⇒ ( x − 4 ) ( x + 1 ) < 0 \begin{array}{l} x^{2}-3 x-4<0 \\ \Rightarrow x^{2}-4 x+x-4<0 \Rightarrow x(x-4)+1(x-4)<0 \\ \Rightarrow(x-4)(x+1)<0 \end{array} x 2 − 3 x − 4 < 0 ⇒ x 2 − 4 x + x − 4 < 0 ⇒ x ( x − 4 ) + 1 ( x − 4 ) < 0 ⇒ ( x − 4 ) ( x + 1 ) < 0 ​ The product of two elements becomes negative or less than zero when one of them is negative and another is positive

questions.question: A train takes 10 seconds to cross a pole and 20 seconds to cross a platform of length 200 m . What is the length of train?
questions.explanation: Let, the length of train = x   m =x \mathrm{~m} = x   m . the velocity of train = v m s − 1 =\mathrm{v} \mathrm{ms}^{-1} = v ms − 1 A. Q Q Q . x = v .10. & 200 + x = y .20 ⇒ x = 10 v ⇒ 200 + x = 2.10 v ⇒ 200 + x = 2 x ∴ x = 200 m \begin{aligned} x=v .10 . & \& 200+x=y .20 \\ \Rightarrow x=10 v & \Rightarrow 200+x=2.10 v \\ & \Rightarrow 200+x=2 x \quad \therefore x=200 m \end{aligned} x = v .10. ⇒ x = 10 v ​ &200 + x = y .20 ⇒ 200 + x = 2.10 v ⇒ 200 + x = 2 x ∴ x = 200 m ​

questions.question: If n \mathbf{n} n is a positive integer, what is the remainder when n 3 − n n^{3}-n n 3 − n is divided by 24 ? i. n \mathbf{n} n can be divided by 8 ii. n \mathbf{n} n is greater than 3

options.label: ক
options.text: Statement (i) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (ii) alone is not sufficient.

options.label: খ
options.text: Statement (ii) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (i) alone is not sufficient.

options.label: গ
options.text: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.

questions.option_a: Statement (i) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (ii) alone is not sufficient.
questions.option_b: Statement (ii) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (i) alone is not sufficient.
questions.option_c: BOTH statements TOGETHER are sufficient, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.
questions.explanation: Statement (i) says n n n can be divided by 8 that means, n = 8 , 16 , 24 n=8,16,24 n = 8 , 16 , 24 \qquad Where the smallest integer is 8 , which is greater than 3 (statement (ii)). That means, statement (i) covers statement (ii).

questions.question: 5.133 multipled by 10 − 7 10^{-7} 1 0 − 7 is equal to

On his first 3 tests, Rajeev received an average score of N \mathbf{N} N points. If on his fourth test, he exceeds his previous average score by 20 points, what is his average score for his first 4 tests?
questions.explanation: Total score in four test = 3   N + N + 20 4 = N + 5 =\frac{3 \mathrm{~N}+\mathrm{N}+20}{4}=\mathrm{N}+5 = 4 3   N + N + 20 ​ = N + 5

questions.question: A pump installed on a well can pump at a maximum rate of 100 gallons per minute. If the town requires 15 , 000 \mathbf{1 5 , 0 0 0} 15 , 000 gallons of water in one day, how long would the pump have to continuously run at 75 % \mathbf{7 5 \%} 75% of its maximum rate to meet the town's need?
questions.explanation: Maximum rate of the pump = 100 =100 = 100 gallons / m i n / \mathrm{min} / min ∴ 75 % \therefore 75 \% ∴ 75% of its maximum rate = 75 =75 = 75 gallons / m i n / \mathrm{min} / min ∴ \therefore ∴ To fill up town's need the pump will take = 15000 75   m i n = 200   m i n =\frac{15000}{75} \mathrm{~min}=200 \mathrm{~min} = 75 15000 ​   min = 200   min .

questions.question: Alejandro, working alone, can build a doghouse in 4 hours. Betty can build the same doghouse in 3 hours. If Betty and Carmelo, working together, can build the doghouse twice as fast as Alejandro, how long would it take Carmelo, working alone, to build the doghouse?
questions.explanation: Alejandro can build the doghous in 4 hr . In 1 hr Betty can build = 1 3 =\frac{1}{3} = 3 1 ​ part of the doghouse. & \& & In 1 hr Betty and Carmelo can build = 1 2 =\frac{1}{2} = 2 1 ​ part of the doghouse [ ∴ \therefore ∴ Betty & carmelo is twice as fast as Alejandro]. ∴ \therefore ∴ Carmelo alone can build in 1 h r = ( 1 2 − 1 3 ) 1 \mathrm{hr}=\left(\frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{3}\right) 1 hr = ( 2 1 ​ − 3 1 ​ ) part = 1 6 =\frac{1}{6} = 6 1 ​ part. ∴ \therefore ∴ Carmelo alone take to build the doghous = 1 1 / 6 h r = 6 h r =\frac{1}{1 / 6} \mathrm{hr}=6 \mathrm{hr} = 1/6 1 ​ hr = 6 hr .

questions.question: Which number in the answer choices below is not equivalent to the other numbers?
If Lucy walks to work at a rate of 4 miles per hour, but she walks home by the same route at a rate of 6 miles per hour, what is Lucy's average walking rate for the round trip?
questions.explanation: Solve average walk = 2 × 4 × 6 4 + 6 = 4.8 m p h =\frac{2 \times 4 \times 6}{4+6}=4.8 \mathrm{mph} = 4 + 6 2 × 4 × 6 ​ = 4.8 mph

questions.question: Harvey runs a 30 − m i l e 30-\mathrm{mile} 30 − mile course at a constant rate of 4 miles per hour. If Clyde runs the same track at a constant rate and completes the course in 90 fewer minutes, how fast did Clyde run?
questions.explanation: Hervey can complete the course = 30 4 h r = 7.5 h r = 450   m i n =\frac{30}{4} \mathrm{hr}=7.5 \mathrm{hr}=450 \mathrm{~min} = 4 30 ​ hr = 7.5 hr = 450   min . Clyde can complete = ( 450 − 90 ) m i n = 360   m i n . = 6 h r =(450-90) \mathrm{min}=360 \mathrm{~min} .=6 \mathrm{hr} = ( 450 − 90 ) min = 360   min . = 6 hr . ∴ \therefore ∴ Clyde run = 30 6 m p h = 5 m p h =\frac{30}{6} \mathrm{mph}=5 \mathrm{mph} = 6 30 ​ mph = 5 mph .

questions.question: An alloy weighing 24 ounces is 70 percent gold. How many ounces of pure gold must be added to create an alloy that is 90 percent gold?
questions.explanation: Total alloy weighing = 24 =24 = 24 ounce. ∴ \therefore ∴ Gold = 24 × 70 100 = 16.8 =24 \times \frac{70}{100}=16.8 = 24 × 100 70 ​ = 16.8 ounce. Let, x x x ounce of pure gold must be added.  A.Q.  16.8 + x = ( 24 + x ) × 90 % = ( 24 + x ) × 90 100 ⇒ 168 + 10 x = 216 + 9 x ∴ x = 48 \begin{array}{l} \text { A.Q. } 16.8+\mathrm{x}=(24+\mathrm{x}) \times 90 \%=(24+\mathrm{x}) \times \frac{90}{100} \\ \Rightarrow 168+10 \mathrm{x}=216+9 \mathrm{x} \therefore \mathrm{x}=48 \end{array}  A.Q.  16.8 + x = ( 24 + x ) × 90% = ( 24 + x ) × 100 90 ​ ⇒ 168 + 10 x = 216 + 9 x ∴ x = 48 ​

questions.question: Choose the number that is 1 8 \frac{1}{8} 8 1 ​ of 1 5 \frac{1}{5} 5 1 ​ of 1 5 \frac{1}{5} 5 1 ​ of 200 :

A circus earned $ 150000 \$ 150000 $150000 in ticket revenue by selling 1,800 V.I.P. and Standard tickets. They sold 25 % 25 \% 25% more Standard tickets than V.I.P tickets. If the revenue from Standard tickets represents one -third of the total ticket revenue, what is the price of a V.I.P ticket?

Sam earned a $ 2 , 000 \$ 2,000 $2 , 000 commission on a single big sale, raising his average commission by $ 100 \$ 100 $100 .If Sam's new average commission by $ 900 \boldsymbol{\$ 9 0 0} $900 , how many sales has he made?
questions.explanation: Let, total number of sales prior to the big sale S and the average commission prior to the big sale be A . ∴ \therefore ∴ Total commission earned prior to the big sale = A × S =\mathrm{A} \times \mathrm{S} = A × S . Total commission earnd after the big sale = A × S + 2000 =A \times S+2000 = A × S + 2000 . Total number of sales including the big sale = S + 1 =S+1 = S + 1 . Now, 900 = 900= 900 = Average commission prior to the big sale + 100 = A + 100 +100=A+100 + 100 = A + 100 Implies, A = 900 − 100 = 800 A=900-100=800 A = 900 − 100 = 800 A.Q. Average commission after the big sale be A = A= A = Total commission earned after the big sale / Total number of sales including the big sale ⇒ ( A × S + 2000 ) / ( S + 1 ) = 900 ⇒ 800   S + 2000   S + 1 = 900 ⇒ 800   S + 2000 = 900   S + 900 ⇒ 100   S = 1100 ∴ S = 11 ∴ S + 1 = 11 + 1 = 12  Total number sales he made.  \begin{array}{l} \Rightarrow(\mathrm{A} \times \mathrm{S}+2000) /(\mathrm{S}+1)=900 \\ \Rightarrow \frac{800 \mathrm{~S}+2000}{\mathrm{~S}+1}=900 \Rightarrow 800 \mathrm{~S}+2000=900 \mathrm{~S}+900 \\ \Rightarrow 100 \mathrm{~S}=1100 \therefore \mathrm{S}=11 \\ \therefore \mathrm{S}+1=11+1=12 \text { Total number sales he made. } \end{array} ⇒ ( A × S + 2000 ) / ( S + 1 ) = 900 ⇒   S + 1 800   S + 2000 ​ = 900 ⇒ 800   S + 2000 = 900   S + 900 ⇒ 100   S = 1100 ∴ S = 11 ∴ S + 1 = 11 + 1 = 12  Total number sales he made.  ​

questions.question: Raina has money in two separate bank accounts. Account X X X earns 10 % 10 \% 10% interest annually and account Y Y Y earns 16 % 16 \% 16% interest annually. Raina earned a total of $ 75 \$ 75 $75 in interest. last year. If the total amount of money in the account at the beginning of last year was $ 600 \$ 600 $600 , and there were no other deposits or withdrawals, how much money was in account X X X ?
questions.explanation: For account X X X , Principle, p 1 = p \mathrm{p}_{1}=p p 1 ​ = p Interest, = I 1 =\mathrm{I}_{1} = I 1 ​ Rate, r 1 = 10 % \mathrm{r}_{1}=10 \% r 1 ​ = 10% ∴ I 1 = p 1 n I \therefore \mathrm{I}_{1}=\mathrm{p}_{1} \mathrm{n}_{\mathrm{I}} ∴ I 1 ​ = p 1 ​ n I ​ ⇒ I 1 = \Rightarrow I_{1}= ⇒ I 1 ​ = p. 1 ⋅ 10 100 ⇒ I 1 = p 10 1 \cdot \frac{10}{100} \Rightarrow I_{1}=\frac{p}{10} 1 ⋅ 100 10 ​ ⇒ I 1 ​ = 10 p ​  For account,  Y ,  Principle,  p 2 = 600 − p  Interest  = I 2  Rate,  r 2 = 16 % ∴ I 2 = p 2 n r 2 = ( 600 − p ) .1 ⋅ 16 100 \begin{array}{l} \text { For account, } Y, \\ \text { Principle, } p_{2}=600-p \\ \text { Interest }=I_{2} \\ \text { Rate, } r_{2}=16 \% \\ \therefore I_{2}=p_{2} n r_{2} \\ =(600-p) .1 \cdot \frac{16}{100} \end{array}  For account,  Y ,  Principle,  p 2 ​ = 600 − p  Interest  = I 2 ​  Rate,  r 2 ​ = 16% ∴ I 2 ​ = p 2 ​ n r 2 ​ = ( 600 − p ) .1 ⋅ 100 16 ​ ​ According to the Question, I 1 + I 2 = 75 ⇒ p 10 + ( 600 − p ) ⋅ 16 100 = 75 ⇒ p 10 + 600 × 16 100 − 16 p 100 = 75 ⇒ 10 p − 16 p 100 + 96 = 75 ⇒ − 6 p = − 2100 ∴ p = 350 \begin{array}{l} I_{1}+I_{2}=75 \\ \Rightarrow \frac{p}{10}+(600-p) \cdot \frac{16}{100}=75 \Rightarrow \frac{p}{10}+\frac{600 \times 16}{100}-\frac{16 p}{100}=75 \\ \Rightarrow \frac{10 p-16 p}{100}+96=75 \Rightarrow-6 p=-2100 \therefore p=350 \end{array} I 1 ​ + I 2 ​ = 75 ⇒ 10 p ​ + ( 600 − p ) ⋅ 100 16 ​ = 75 ⇒ 10 p ​ + 100 600 × 16 ​ − 100 16 p ​ = 75 ⇒ 100 10 p − 16 p ​ + 96 = 75 ⇒ − 6 p = − 2100 ∴ p = 350 ​

questions.question: All of the following have the same set of unique prime factors EXCEPT?
questions.explanation: 980 = 2 × 2 × 5 × 7 × 7 350 = 2 × 5 × 5 × 7 770 = 2 × 5 × 7 × 11 560 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 × 5 × 7 \begin{array}{l} 980=2 \times 2 \times 5 \times 7 \times 7 \\ 350=2 \times 5 \times 5 \times 7 \\ 770=2 \times 5 \times 7 \times 11 \\ 560=2 \times 2 \times 2 \times 2 \times 5 \times 7 \end{array} 980 = 2 × 2 × 5 × 7 × 7 350 = 2 × 5 × 5 × 7 770 = 2 × 5 × 7 × 11 560 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 × 5 × 7 ​ Here the prime factors of 770 are different from others.

questions.question: At the end of a banquet 10 people shake hands with each other. How many handshakes will there be in total?
questions.explanation: Number of hadshake in total = 10 C 2 = 45 ={ }^{10} \mathrm{C}_{2}=45 = 10 C 2 ​ = 45

questions.question: A large delicatessen purchased P P P pounds of cheese for C \mathbf{C} C dollars per pound. If D pounds of the cheese had to be discarded due to spoilage and the delicatessen sold the rest for S S S dollars per pound, which of the following represents the gross profit on the sale of the purchase?

options.label: ক
options.text: ( P − D ) ( S − C ) (\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})(\mathrm{S}-\mathrm{C}) ( P − D ) ( S − C )

options.label: খ
options.text: S ( P − D ) − P C \mathrm{S}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})-\mathrm{PC} S ( P − D ) − PC

questions.option_a: ( P − D ) ( S − C ) (\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})(\mathrm{S}-\mathrm{C}) ( P − D ) ( S − C )
questions.option_b: S ( P − D ) − P C \mathrm{S}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})-\mathrm{PC} S ( P − D ) − PC
questions.explanation: Total cost = P C =\mathrm{PC} = PC , Total sell price = S ( P − D ) =\mathbf{S}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D}) = S ( P − D ) ∴ \therefore ∴ profit = S ( P − D ) − P C =\mathrm{S}(\mathrm{P}-\mathrm{D})-\mathrm{PC} = S ( P − D ) − PC .

questions.question: The day before the day before yesterday is three days after Saturday. What day is it today?
questions.explanation: The day before the day before yesterday = 3 days Three days after saturday = Tuesday. Now, Tuesday + 3 days = Friday.

questions.question: What is the missing number in this series? 82611 ? 141812
questions.explanation: The missing number is 9 . Logic, The sum of number starting from and last is 20 . 8 + 12 = 20 2 + 18 = 20 6 + 14 = 20 11 + 9 = 20 \begin{array}{l} 8+12=20 \\ 2+18=20 \\ 6+14=20 \\ 11+9=20 \end{array} 8 + 12 = 20 2 + 18 = 20 6 + 14 = 20 11 + 9 = 20 ​
